dialog.body: My "home office". It was really just a desk in the corner of the living room, but it was enough room for my computer and my drawer of important-things-that-should-really-be-better-organized.
That day, I found it impossible to concentrate. My eyelids felt like lead, and I kept finding excuses to distract myself.
dialog.option: 1. I lay my head down on the desk and closed my eyes.
2. I got up and went to the kitchen to do some dishes.

dialog.body: I could hear the air conditioner droning in the next room. Traffic rumbled from the overpass a few blocks away.

scene.title: A Large Stork Perched on the Desk
scene.name: office-stork-appears

dialog.body: "Good afternoon." A large stork was perched on the edge of my desk. "I say, have you seen my hat?"
dialog.option: 1. I was so stunned that I responded immediately.
2. I was so stunned that I couldn't speak.

scene.title: A Large Stork Perched on the Desk
scene.name: office-stork-hat-response

dialog.body: "I'm afraid I haven't seen your hat," I said, trying to affect a confident tone. "That is... what does it look like?"
"Well, it's black," said the stork, "Soft, sort of a long stocking cap. It's dreadfully clever, and has magic properties. Ring any bells?"
dialog.option: 1. Magic properties? I had to know more.
2. Magic properties? All I had to offer was a blank stare.

scene.title: A Large Stork Perched on the Desk
scene.name: office-stork-hat-unfamiliar

dialog.body: The stork's feathers bristled. "That wretched cat has hidden it," it said, "I knew it, of course. Her aggressive gestures shall be punished with stern words."
